result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael K. Pierce Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

W/Huber for all purposes
To commence on/before

records.addlTxt: Per Nicole at ONSO - in custody Oneida County
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

01:58 pm - Defendant Michael K. Pierce in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend to 946.425(1m) a Class A Misdemeanor - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Schiek/Bennett/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence
Fine $100/DNA Surcharge $200
Jail 5 days w/Huber for all purposes - To commence on/before 07-24-15 at 8 am
Appeal rights given  Review hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned 02:15 p.m.

Defendant Michael K. Pierce in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael H Schiek  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.
Information to be filed will mirror the complaint - Bennett willing to proceed to arraignment - Will receive information when filed- enters not guilty plea
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

03:25 pm -MAM for PFO -  Defendant Michael K. Pierce in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states received called from Bennett indicating a medical emergency unable to appear.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing.  Bail continued.

Defendant Michael K. Pierce in court with attorney John Voorhess for Brian F. Bennett.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:41
In receipt, waive reading - request adj so attorney Bennett can appear - 
Bail continued  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

01:17 pm - Defendant Michael K. Pierce in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant unsure as to obtaining counsel ,  Schiek/Defendant statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
